info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 28 at 6:27PM CDT until March 28 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS Brownsville TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring.
* WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following counties, Cameron, Hidalgo and Willacy.
* WHEN...Until 930 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 622 PM CDT, Flooding from heavy rains on Thursday is already occurring. Between 10 and 20 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Harlingen, San Benito, Mercedes, La Feria, Progreso, Santa Rosa, Rio Hondo, Palm Valley, Los Indios, Laureles, La Paloma, Rangerville, Arroyo City, Santa Maria, Brownsville, Primera, Combes, Rio Hondo City Hall, Rio Hondo Junior High School and Rio Hondo Elementary School. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Cameron, TX; Hidalgo, TX; Willacy, TX
